citeinfo.title: Environmental Remediation Sites - New York State (NYSDEC)

descript.abstract: Service layer is updated daily.For more information or to download layer see the NYS GIS ClearinghouseDownload the metadata to learn more information about how the data was created and details about the attributes. Use the links within the metadata document to expand the sections of interest. http://gis.ny.gov/gisdata/metadata/nysdec.remedsite_borders_export.htmlThese are sites of environmental cleanup and safe brownfield redevelopment. DEC's remediation and enforcement programs ensure the timely and efficient cleanup and redevelopment of contaminated properties.
descript.purpose: DEC database record for individual cleanup site and documents when available

idinfo.useconst: 1. The NYS DEC asks to be credited in derived products. 2. Secondary Distribution of the data is not allowed. 3. Any documentation provided is an integral part of the data set. Failure to use the documentation in conjunction with the digital data constitutes misuse of the data. 4. Although every effort has been made to ensure the accuracy of information, errors may be reflected in the data supplied. The user must be aware of data conditions and bear responsibility for the appropriate use of the information with respect to possible errors, original map scale, collection methodology, currency of data, and other conditions.

cntorgp.cntorg: New York State Department of Environmental Conservation

idinfo.datacred: The NYS DEC asks to be credited in derived products.

enttyp.enttypd: NYSDEC div. of Environmental Remediation remediation sites

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The Site Code (a.k.a. Site ID No., Site Number) is the Registry number assigned by the NYSDEC. The first digit represents the NYSDEC Region in which the site is located, the next two digits represent the county, and the final three digits designate the particular site within the county. Some sites bear a letter following the final three digits. Site Codes which include a letter following the six digit number are known by the entire string.
The Site Name is the formal name of the site as assigned by the NYSDEC.
The Division of Environmental Remediation Program under which the site is being investigated and/or cleaned up. Additional information can be found at http://www.dec.ny.gov/about/627.html .

The Site Class record is the site's classification according to the Hazardous Waste Site Classification System. Site classifications of 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5 only apply to sites being remediated under the State Superfund Program and indicates the degree of threat and the status of the site in the remedial process. Site classifications of C or A apply to the other Division Programs - Environmental Restoration Program, Voluntary Cleanup Program, and Brownfield Cleanup Program.
Street address for the site's location.
Street address for the site's location.
City, town or village where the site is located.
ZIP CODE for the site's address.
The county name.
The town name.
The region number corresponds to one of the nine NYSDEC regions in which the site is located.
NYTM x coordinate of site centroid
NYTM y coordinate of site centroid
An accuracy method code given to classify the accuracy of the data point.
